bibl.title: Two Tales, Two Cities: Antinoopolis and Nottingham.
bibl.note: 1. Novel evidence for Justinian's legislation at Antinoopolis. [Identification of P.S.I. XIII, 1346 (= C.P.L. 233; M.-P.3 2988; LDAB 5941) with Justinian's Novel 62 (= Authenticum 64), De senatoribus, addressed to John the Cappadocian.] - 2. The Park, Nottingham [residence of Wolf Liebeschuetz].

bibl.title: Wolf Liebeschuetz Reflected: Essays Presented by Colleagues, Friends and Pupils.

bibl.seg: Corcoran Simon, Two Tales, Two Cities: Antinoopolis and Nottingham.
John Drinkwater and Benet Salway (Edd.), Wolf Liebeschuetz Reflected: Essays Presented by Colleagues, Friends and Pupils = BICS. Supplement 91 (London, 2007) pp. 193-209, 3 figg.

1. Novel evidence for Justinian's legislation at Antinoopolis. [Identification of P.S.I. XIII, 1346 (= C.P.L. 233; M.-P.3 2988; LDAB 5941) with Justinian's Novel 62 (= Authenticum 64), De senatoribus, addressed to John the Cappadocian.] - 2. The Park, Nottingham [residence of Wolf Liebeschuetz].
